content.description:
This is an alluring line from a distance, and a deceptive one when you are looking up from the base of it. The climbing demands steep slab skills, a calm heart on tenuous, low percentage smears, as well as, bizarre stemming which demands a loose interpretation of the laws of physics...

 A unique test piece that is also good training for the first pitch of PMT .12- on the Trundlers Club Buttress.
content.location: This line is hard to miss as you first gain the Lower Beach.  To the right of Reef Shark.

content.description: Dihedral, mixed route with one bolt at the bottom, one bolt at the top, small gear placements in between the bolts, and rap anchors.
content.protection: 2 bolts, small gear (nuts, small cams). 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: 10-15 feet to the climber's right of Typhoon.

climbs.name: Reef Shark
climbs.fa: John Burcham, Seth Dyer, James Q Martin

content.description: Follow 3 bolts up & left to gain a very nice thin hands splitter.
content.protection: 3 draws, single set of cams from .3 thru #3 camalot, with 2-3 #.75s and maybe an extra #1.  Bolted rap anchor.
content.location: The obvious thin hands splitter on the Lower Beach wall.

content.description: Start on a sandy slab into a  semi-awkward flare over a bulge. Stem, shimmey, and skum up the open book with good rests.  Semi-portable edges on the right side help progress upwards.  Then, jam up the fun .75/1 sized crack, which after 15' opens up to a wider, easy section to the anchors.
content.protection:
1x nuts, 1C3-3   2x .3-2 

  Currently has 2 leaver biners for lowering.
content.location: Same start as Reef Shark.  When RS breaks left to the bolt, continue straight up into the flare.

content.description: Nice line over the obvious arete on the Lower Beach face. Climbing is fun, with a clear crux on the slab just above the last bolt.
content.location: Shares the first two bolts with Typhoon, and than goes to the left and up the arete.

content.description: The cliffs directly above The Planetarium.  Some nice trad lines and a couple sport routes also.  Stays sunny in the afternoon.
